titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abraham Epstein Papers
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion June 26, 2009

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Research Director, Pennsylvania Commission on Old Age Pensions, 1918-1921 and 1923-1927; Executive Secretary, American Association for Social Security, 1927-1942.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, documents, minutes, lists, reports, financial records, and printed materials of Abraham Epstein. The personal and business papers relate to his fight on behalf of Social Security and old age pensions.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.subject: Social security--United States.
Old age pensions.
Older people--Economic conditions.
Social problems.
controlaccess.corpname: Pennsylvania Commission of Old Age Pensions.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 2-86 of this collections are are located off-site. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abraham Epstein Papers. Rare Book and Manuscript Library. Columbia University.
